definition: direct (opposite: indirect 間接|间接[jian4 jie1])/immediate/straightforward
straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb

pinyin: wai4 shang1 zhi2 jie1 tou2 zi1

definition: see 直截了當|直截了当[zhi2 jie2 liao3 dang4]

pinyin: fu2 she4 zhi2 jie1 xiao4 ying4

sentences.english: Both men had direct contact with dead chickens when feeding carcasses to their dogs.
sentences.chinese: 這兩名男子均在將死雞屍體餵狗時直接接觸了死雞。

sentences.english: Direct fetal injury is an infrequent complication of blunt trauma.
sentences.chinese: 胎兒直接損傷是鈍器傷的罕見併發症。

sentences.english: This is a foreign exchange trader direct experience.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個外匯交易的直接經驗。

sentences.english: CATV signals travel strightyly high up into the space from TV stations.
sentences.chinese: 有線電視信號從電視臺直接送入空間。

sentences.english: View build history and build status directly in Mingle.
sentences.chinese: 在Mingle中直接觀看構建歷史與構建狀態。

sentences.english: What happens in disputes between direct buyer and seller?
sentences.chinese: 直接購買者與出售者之間發生哪些爭端？

sentences.english: This pesticide is diluted with water and applied directly to the fields.
sentences.chinese: 這種殺蟲劑用水稀釋後直接施用在田裏。

sentences.english: Residents fled smack into the plume of air carrying radioactive debris.
sentences.chinese: 他們直接逃進了空氣中充斥着核碎片的地區。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, we cannot send other Test Report forms to you directly.
sentences.chinese: 但是，我們不能將額外的成績單直接寄給您本人。

sentences.english: Do we get a salary slip even if we sign up for direct deposit ?
sentences.chinese: 如果工資直接存款的話，能拿到工資條嗎？

sentences.english: Now the number has reached closely to 250, half of which have direct investment in sino-foreign joint ventures.
sentences.chinese: 其中有半數直接投資於中外合資企業。

sentences.english: Luckily, it's very straight-forward and takes less than half an hour.
sentences.chinese: 幸運的是，這是非常直接的，並考慮不到一個半小時。

sentences.english: After we left our luggages in the hotel, then went to visit Tian'an men Square directly.
sentences.chinese: 我們把行李放到酒店後，就直接去參觀天安門。

sentences.english: We need physical access to a computer with a keyboard hooked directly to it.
sentences.chinese: 需要用直接連接到計算機上的鍵盤來物理訪問計算機。

sentences.english: It was the first-ever direct communication from Bush to Kim.
sentences.chinese: 這是布什和金正日之間的第一次直接溝通。

sentences.english: The merchants realized that it was important to expand the clan influence if they wanted to get wealthy.
sentences.chinese: 商人認識到擴大宗族勢力與自身致富有直接的關係。

definition: at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning
to watch from a height or distance/to survey
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
again/once more/re-/second/another/then (after sth, and not until then)/no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis)
to take advantage/to seize an opportunity/in passing/without taking extra trouble/conveniently
to do sth by force/Taiwan pr. [qiang3 xing2]
outcome/result/conclusion/in the end/as a result/to kill/to dispatch
